examples: the reports of the commission are often referred to in the media
New York, referred to as the Big Apple

verb.description: Pass a matter to (another body, typically one with more authority or expertise) for a decision.
examples: disagreement arose and the issue was referred back to the Executive Committee

verb.description: Trace or attribute something to (someone or something) as a cause or source.
examples: the God to whom he habitually referred his highest inspirations

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French referer or Latin referre carry back, from re- back + ferre bring.
